name: Klepto Chaos v1
Make Money While Hurting People
description: Still new to netrunner, but I wanted to put something together that really punishes the runner in a variety of ways while never having to worry about money.

name: HAAS shutdown
GenroGabe
GenroGabe 2.0
Rielle "KITT" Peddler - "Morgenwelt" Store Championship 3/29
description: Store Championship @ "Morgenwelt" store, March 29, 2014 - Berlin, Germany. "Double Time" was not legal.

name: NBN "Making Blues" - "Morgenwelt" Store Championship 3/29
description: 1st Place @ "Morgenwelt" Store Championship, March 29, 2014 - Berlin, Germany. "Double Time" was not legal.

name: Jinteki PE  - Take your pick
description: I'll add some more comments later, after having playtested it more. So far however it has beeing doing remarkebly well. Alot of times I'll have enough counters to score a Nesie or Braintrust but let it stay on the board. Often they are too afraid to take riskt it being a Junebug or Overwriter. I often rune 4-6 remotes, sometimes more, and prefer icing centrals. Of course, since runners are usually very careful, trying to keep a full grip, and since when they run they often don't need icebreakers, they often end up discarding important icrebreakers which can allow some rush in the mid to late game.

name: Never Run Anarch
Never Run Anarch
Silencer Gabriel
description:
Pretty cookie-cutter Gabriel, but with Silencers and Daggers over Faeries and Femme. The singular E3 over a third plascrete is just personal preference, but also helps for saving Silencer credits for Dagger

I'm finding Silencer and Dagger to be a fairly cheap alternative to the standard sentry breakers. The sentries that have greater than 5 strength are: Snoop, Janus, and Archer, and having data sucker out is important if you suspect it.

It's worthy of note that Roto is strength 0, so a Dagger out without a silencer can still break it. Roto is often what I'm worried about, and if I do encounter it, silencer just becomes a recurring credit to breaking it. Its also important to save your silencer credits if you suspect unrezzed sentries. Losing programs to an Archer behind a Roto because you used your Silencers on the Roto is an embarassing mistake I have made

name: Never Run Anarch
Whizzard - Toolbox
The Right Tool for the Job v1.8 (2nd @ local tournament)
description:
I've done a lot of modifications to this deck in the last weeks and decided to take it to the last small tournament we had in my hometown. Didn't make it to first place because my Corp deck (Cerebral Imaging - Next Gen Fast Advance) failed me... got my HQ full of Agenda way too soon in the last game.

Anyway this deck has been undefeated in said tournament, against Jinteki: RP (spamming remotes), Weyland Tag n Bag and NBN Tag n Bag / FA hybrid.

It can run with very little money thanks to Deus Ex / Sharpshooter and the high Link value that makes Tracers almost completely useless.

And then there's IMP, allowing to save a ton of money and making life very hard for SanSan based NBN decks. Or any deck using Midseason / Scorched Earth... just run their hands multiple times and trash them for good. Recycle IMP on-the-fly if needed.

Expecting some Tag n Bag I added 2 copies of Plascrete just in case, to allow more freedom without the constant need to watch your credits to be above the Corp. It works very well even without, but you have to pay way more attention the the game (well, at least against decks with Midseason Replacements).

name: MIDSEASONS v2
Cyber Brush Rush (Mugging Lab Nerds) 3.0
Rejna the Fortune Teller (BlackGuard)
description:
She will read the cards for you, but she has a price...

Blackguard and Snitch make the Corp rez all its ICE in safety. With the cost increase, a Rejna classic build, it will be very painful. Rez ICE everywhere you can and then run for other servers. Archer and Chimera are very riscky ICE to install against this deck, as the Illicit ones (so common now) if you install Raymond Flint first. Traps are less scary too.

name: BlackMail!
Lleida Store Champs first place (29/3/14)
NEXT Rush (Pandemonium Store Championship 2nd place)
description:
This deck went 3-1-1 on the day.

Runner deck here

Tournament report here

I had a lot of trouble finding a corp deck that I didn't hate for this tournament. I made this deck a week before the event, and was still making significant changes to it two days beforehand. I'm not sure how good this deck actually is, but it has a few qualities that I really like:

  • Its speed puts the runner under pressure and punishes slow/durdly runner decks. You won't lose any games to "never run until they can use Activist Support + New Angeles City Hall to set up blackmail" decks, for example.
  • It's high variance. I don't think you win many games against good runners using safe corp decks. I'd rather allow a lot of free accesses and win when they don't hit too many agendas than try to defend everything and lose most of the time.
  • It matches up decently against Gabe.

The basic plan is to be super aggressive (and I do mean SUPER aggressive) and score agendas behind a 1-3 ice remote until the remote isn't safe anymore, after which you're trying to score the rest from hand with Biotic Labor (or Shipment from SanSan, if you were able to score an Efficiency Committee). Also part of the plan: don't lose to Account Siphon.

Some thoughts on changes that I think should be made:

  • Caduceus should probably be replaced - it's great against some runners, but very weak in some of your less favorable matchups (Andy and Reina, in particular)
  • I wasn't happy with Blue Level Clearance; I think it should be some other econ card. Probably Beanstalk Royalties or Sweeps Week, assuming I free up some influence by replacing Caduceus with other ice.

name: Desperado Kit (Pandemonium Store Championship 2nd place)
description:
This deck went 5-0 on the day.

Corp deck here

Tournament report here

This deck idea started when I came across this deck and had two thoughts:

  • I don't like how 7/10 of the influence is being spent
  • Although the deck does want more MU, I really dislike Akamatsu Mem Chip, especially outside of Kate

I went looking for stuff I might change in light of those points, and realized that Desperado solves both of them. The end result is a deck possessing both significant early game pressure and a solid long game.

A few notes:

No Corroder!?!

Yes, I love getting an early Desperado that much. Inti lets you get through cheap barriers early while the difference between Snowball and Corroder in the late game is not too significant (you might even get to live the dream and make a snowman! but probably not).

No Plascretes? No Levy AR?

Both of these cards are dead most of the time, and not essential in the situations where they're useful. I am of the opinion that Plascretes are for suckers outside of tag-me decks, but they're especially unnecessary here: you have the eco to avoid being SEA Scorched, and you can control your vulnerability to Snare / Punitive. Sometimes you will end up in a super long game where your stack starts to run out (especially with Professional Contacts) - every time this has happened to me I have been able to win anyways.

One Tinkering?

Tinkering is the one card in this deck that I think should be replaced (probably by Deus X). More generally, one thing that I didn't like about the original version of this deck was the one time nature of Scavenge and Tinkering - they'd end up sitting in my hand forever. On paper those cards make you flexible but in practice there's a huge difference between being able to continually adjust and being able to adjust once. I rarely use Scavenge to re-point Cybers and Femmes; they're better off being used to cheat out Torch/Femme with Test Run or for getting back Sharpshooter.

Are there any changes you would make?

While I don't think there are any obviously correct changes to be made (outside of the previously mentioned Deus X for Tinkering), there's definitely room for tweaking to suit your playstyle. Just keep in mind that any change you make to improve your early game will probably weaken your late game, and vice versa. Paintbrush is interesting; I'm going to try it out. If you have ideas that you think would improve the deck I would love to hear them!

Anything else?

Sure, have some random thoughts:

  • Cheating out an early Torch feels so unfair
  • Sharpshooter is SO GOOD; I don't think this deck would work without it. Having an SMC out lets you continue runs when you would otherwise have to jack out for fear of program-trashing ice. Clone Chip (and Scavenge) can let you ignore huge pieces of ice (e.g. Archer) that you would otherwise have to pay a ton to break with Femme
  • You could probably safely cut one Kati Jones. I'm afraid to do so because there are some matchups where you really need her
  • The deck's biggest weakness in general is the potential for clunky early game draws. I'm not sure if this is a fixable problem

I hope you enjoy this deck :)

name: Test Run Andy
description: Most recent build. Breaking things without datasuckers costs too much

name: Replicator
Sonic The Datahog
description: A bunch of run events plus full ice destruction on centrals in order to keep datasuckers flowing

name: Advancing Demise v1.2
description:
INTRO

Ever since I saw the Tennin Institute ability I was hooked on the idea of a building a deck for it. Tennin offers a level of flexibility that other abilities don't: advancing is an essential part of winning netrunner whether it's an agenda, trap or piece of ice. The biggest problem with this deck was the abilities condition: "if the Runner did not make a successful run". To succeed with Tennin you need to find ways to reliable end a lot of runs, especially early game, so that you can gain that extra special benefit of free advancement. Advancing a card is worth two clicks, one to get money and another to place the advancement token on it so it Tennin's ability is especially useful.

STRATEGY

Ice

Playing advancable ice is a necessity in this deck as it gives you something to do with free advancements that you get when there's no agenda around. A strong Ice Wall or highly advanced Hadrian's Wall will sufficiently drain the runner enough and protect them from parasites. Chimera is a very good Paintbrush obstacle and allows you to be even more certain of keeping the runner out early game when they don't have every icebreaker.

Economy

Snare allows you to play Celebrity Gift without too much exposure. Commercialisation is a fantastic card in this deck because you can actually make money from it rather than getting money back: ice that you've advanced for free is now an efficient source of economy, use Jackson to get Commercialisation back a few times. Sundew is of course a nice form of economy but you might have a hard time defending it in this deck, see below.

Servers

Keep your servers to a minimum in this game, ideally five, all protected by at least 1 piece of ice: HQ, R&D, Archives, Sundew and Agendas. You need to protect every server early game otherwise the Runner will stop you from advancing things.

Tricks

This deck excels when you manage to use the available Nisei. Scoring Nisei MK II allows you to start a Nisei MK II train as you may be able to stop the runner accessing the next agenda, advance it once at the start of your turn and then 3 more times to score it. Caprice really helps, play her in a remote to make an agenda particularly hard to score. Akitaro can be used to make it free to repeatedly rez Chimera.

Traps

Tennin is special: it can advance ANY card. So you can make a non advancable asset look like an agenda and confuse the Runner further. In this deck it can be amusing (if you have no other options) to advance an unrezzed piece of ice to give the impression that it is an Ice Wall or Hadrian's Wall, this ability to mislead the runner may prevent them from running until they have enough funds. You can of course use Trick of Light or Commercialisation to profit off of these useless advancements later.

name: Come get some!
description: Jinteki punishment with tons of money.

name: Guiding Light v1.0
description:
End the run early with inexpensive ice as you lightly advance Ice Walls and Shadows while diging with GLC and Jackson for the cards you need. Using MSN on Snare and/or Junebug you create sources to be later used with Trick of Light. As the abilities of these two cards trigger upon access and the fact that few cards render them near or wholly ineffective (i.e. Deus, Exploratory Romp, Singularity, Feedback Filter) you present the runner with a difficult choice - run and suffer the damage to prevent the future Trick of Light, or let the card be. In either case the corp is pleased as long as the Ice Walls and Shadows remain twice advanced.

I believe as MSN becomes commonplace most runners will assume that MSN will be played in conjunction with an ambush of some kind. They would be correct. However, if occasionally played on Medical Breakthrough - the agenda then if stolen or allowed to be scored by the corp greatly accelerates the game in favor of the corp as all other Breakthroughs are now as cheap or cheaper to score than Braintrust - all of which can be Trick of lighted from hand to score in a game where only six points are needed to clinch victory. Card draw in this build allows you get what you need to score and bring the game up to match point quickly without giving the runner too much time to setup. The agenda Future Prefect is used here as a safety net of sorts. As long as it remains uninstalled you have an opportunity to prevent a steal from happening. (best to keep those agendas in hand with a snare or two or archives with Shinobi in waiting)

For ice I chose very cheap ETR pieces alongside Shadow for the advancing capabilties, money, and tags outside of Snare to punish resource economy and further, Shinobi to punish a careless runner eager to score as quickly as possible.

Note: I'm a huge fan of Caprice and if she was to go in I would certainly replace Yagura.

Think there is any promise in this thing?

Cheers!
